U-2s Deployed in U.S. Air Force Base in S. Korea 
   Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- The U.S. Air Force stationed in south Korea has deployed new-type U-2s in its Osan base, according to the south Korean Yonhap News on June 26.
 It has replaced the U-2 10-type planes with U-2 20-type ones reformed with latest equipment in accordance with the plan for modernizing aerial equipment for reconnaissance.    
 Osan-based U-2s are committing espionage on the strategic objects in the area of the DPRK, flying along the Military Demarcation Line tens of times a day.

articles.content:
Czech Ambassador Presents Credentials to Kim Yong Nam 
   Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Martin Tomco, Czech ambassador e. p. to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Thursday. 
 On hand were Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kung Sok Ung and Czech embassy officials.    
 After receiving credentials the president conversed with the ambassador.

Responsible Role in Achieving National Reunification Declared
   Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- The Chonnam National University Student Committee of the Democratic Workers' Party of south Korea in its inaugural declaration on June 19 said it would fulfill its responsibility and role in putting an end to the history of the nation's division lasting more than half a century, implementing the June 15 joint declaration under the banner of "By our nation itself" and achieving national reunification, according to a media report.
 The history of the Korean people is a history of a struggle for clamping a lid on division and exploitation by outside forces and on dictatorship and suppression and pioneering a new era, and a history of victories, the declaration said.    
 The Chonnam National University Student Committee of the Democratic Workers' Party will vigorously fly the flag of victory at the head of the struggle for national reunification, it stated.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Democratic Congo
Greetings to Sudanese President
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Democratic Congo
   Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of greetings to Major General Joseph Kabila, president of Democratic Congo, on the occasion of the 46th anniversary of its independence.
 The message sincerely wished the president great success in his work to achieve lasting peace and progress of the country, expressing the belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to develop in the future, too.

articles.content:
Greetings to Sudanese President
   Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greetings to Sudanese President Omar Hassan Ahmed Al-Bashir on the occasion of the 17th day of the Sudanese revolution.
 The message wished the Sudanese president success in his work for stability and prosperity of the country, expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative ties between the two countries would grow stronger in the future.
